artificial-intelligence-and-machine-lear.description:
Artificial Intelligence is a technology that is already impacting how users interact with, and are affected by the internet. In the near future, its impact is likely to only continue to grow. Machine Learning is a method of data analysis that automates analytical model building. It is branch of artificial intelligence based on the idea that systems can learn from data, identify patterns and make decisions with minimal human intervention.As of 2017, a quarter of organizations are spending 15% or more of their IT budget on machine learning capabilities, and the number of machine learning examples are expected to rise in the near future.

Altsense is an IOT, Robotics and automation company. They train and guide people towards advanced technology. Their main objective is to find solutions to everything related to robotics and automation. They are specialized in robotics, embedded systems, machine learning, arduino, Raspberry pi, python, 3D printing, IOT, artificial intelligence, automation, technology, deep learning.

4.	Participant(s) will be judged based on the unique creativity, presentation skills and format.

1.concrete-challenge.description:
Concrete Challenge:

Concrete which the universal material is used for construction purpose worldwide. There are different types of concrete depending on the type of binding material used. Cement which is used as a major binding material is used extensively, commonly known as cement concrete. Many research and developments are happening under this material such that is could me more environmental and user friendly as possible. In this event we urge you to do the same by solving our more fun and realistic problem statement which requires a decent understanding of concrete mix proportions, mold and asthetics. More wastes in this world are produced due to improper usage of recyclable materials.Thus we urge our participants to use this recyclable materials in concrete with practical and innovative thinking.

Problem statement:

The concrete specimen should be casted to satisfy the following conditions.
•	The concrete specimen must be a cube specimen of dimension 100 x 100 x 100 (All dimensions are in mm). Tolerance up to 5 mm is appreciated.
•	3 specimens of the above specification must be casted.
•	The specimen must be casted such that value of it’s compressive strength is maximum (High strength concrete).
•	The density of concrete can be from 1400kg/m3 to 2000 kg/m3.
•	Only M25 grade concrete must be used.
•	Recyclable materials must be used as a replacement for aggregates (either partial or full replacement).
•	The cube casted should only have curing period of 3 days and the material added inside the cube for identification purpose will be informed later.
•	An identification marker will be sent by us to all the participants  days before the competition and this must be kept inside the concrete cubes while casting as reference and it is mandatory. Participants without these identification markers will not be permitted in the competition.
•	The cube casted must have a minimum cement content of 300kg/m3.
•	The w/c ratio can be upto 0.55 for the cube casted.
•	Chemical admixtures can be used.
•	The team participating in the event should have a supervisor, who must be a registered faculty member of any engineering college recognized by government of India.
•	Student must carry the college id card throughout the event.
•	Please keep checking your mails and website for further updates.  
•	Event coordinators and managing professor’s decision is/are final and binding. 
•       Download the attachment or if you find any problem in downloading the attachment,it is accepted to send it in your own format.Hence Fill up the mix design clearly ,scan the document and send to the respective mail id 
•	The mix design report must be submitted on or before 17th September 2018(11:59 pm) to "concrete.ssncivil18@gmail.com" duly signed by the supervisor.
•	The submitted mix design report will be shortlisted and the selected participants will be sent a mail regarding the same. Only selected participants can take part in the event.
•	Hard copy of the mix design report should be brought on the day of event.
•	The team with the cube of maximum compressive stress will be the winner.
•	The procedure for casting the concrete specimen must be followed only using IS CODAL PROVISIONS.
•	Failure to abide by the above rules will lead to disqualification from the event.


Score allotment for the concrete specimen:

The score allotment for the cube specimen is as follows;
1.	Density of concrete: Out of 10 marks
(Pre qualification)
2.	Strength of cube specimen: Out of 50 marks
(The marks obtained is directly proportional to strength. As the strength of the specimen is higher, marks awarded also increases).
3.	Finishing of the cube specimen: Out of 15 marks
(The marks awarded will be more when the surfaces of the cube have smooth finishes and the dimensions of the specimen is similar to the problem statement with minimum tolerances).
4.	Viva-Voce: Out of 10 marks
(The marks for this session will be awarded by our college professor as per your team performance).
5.	Mix design report: Out of 15 marks
(The mix design report will be evaluated by our college professor and marks will be awarded).
Total marks: Out of 100 marks.
The team/individual will be awarded the prizes as per maximum marks obtained.

Note:
•	Participation for this event must only be group participation. For team (group) participation, minimum upto 2 members and maximum up to4 members are allowed.
•	The above problem statements must be satisfied for being effectively rewarded marks for the specimen.
•	Participation certificate will be provided.
1.concrete-challenge.tagline: The concrete choice for every application!
rules: Shortlisting the correct and valid mix design report :
1.Must follow the Indian Standard Code procedure.
2.Should design the mix using recyclable materials (either addition or replacement).
Selection Criteria:(on spot)
1.We will check the identification mark on your cube that we had already sent to you,if no identfication mark is found then the team will be directly eliminated.
2.The dimensions of the cube will be checked,if there is any error the mark will be deducted.
3.The density of the cube will be checked,if its not in range the mark will be reduced.
Testing of concrete cubes:
1.The cubes will be tested in compression testing machine .
2.The strength of concrete is determined for 3 cubes and average is taken.
3.The team which has High strength will be considered and the preference will be more to the team which has low density cubes.
Viva:
1.The viva will be asked by one of our professor and the questions will be asked based on your mix design report.

robo-wars.description: Bring your powerful robots ready to battle as you’ll be pitted against other competing robots in one-on-one knockout matches where the aim is to push the opponent’s robot off the arena or immobilizing the other bot and scoring maximum points! Play to your strengths and strategies to win cash prizes!
robo-wars.notes:
Robot Control Requirements:

 If the bot is wired then the wire should remain slack under all circumstances during the competition. All the wires coming out of the bot should be stacked as a single unit. The wires should be properly insulated. Teams are suggested to use only rated wires such as ISI marked. Loose connections or improper wiring may lead to immediate disqualification even before the event. If the bot is controlled wirelessly, the bot must at least have a four-frequency remote control circuit or two dual control circuits which may be interchanged before the start of the race to avoid frequency interference with other teams. The case of any interference in the wireless systems will not be considered for rematch or results. Remote control systems from toys are allowed. Remote control systems available in the market may also be used. Battery and Power: The machine can be powered electrically only. Batteries must be sealed, immobilized- electrolyte types (such as Li-ion, NiCd, NiMH or dry cells). Working voltages must not exceed 24V DC (mean voltage) at any point in time. All power connections must be of an adequate grade and adequately insulated. Cables must be routed to minimize the chances of being cut. All efforts must be made to protect battery terminals from a direct short and causing a battery fire, failure to do so will cause immediate disqualification. Battery Eliminators are allowed and power source would be available at the venue for the eliminators.

Motors:

The robot should move as fast as possible around the arena with the help of motors. DC motors and stepper motors (12V-24V) can be used as per the design of bots. Note: We are not responsible for any damage that your bot may incur during the event.

Score Card: 

The score card is based upon the arena formulation. It is obvious that the robot with an extraordinary dynamism will succeed by thrusting out its combatant from the arena.
If a robot is pushed beyond the ring, the round ends and the other team is awarded the points.
The first team to win X rounds will get through to the Finals where X will be intimated on the day of the competition. Ultimately, if any of the combatants rolls out from the arena it will directly be eliminated from the War Field.
Criteria for triumph: A robot will be declared immobile if it cannot demonstrate linear motion of at least one inch in a timed period of 30 seconds. A bot with one side of its drive train disabled will not be counted out if it can demonstrate some degree of controlled movement. If both robots survive the 5 minutes, the robot with the higher scorecard points wins. The winner advances to the next round while the loser is eliminated from the tournament.

Pre-registration form: https://goo.gl/forms/AFtfnw0iOJwyQEiA3
rules: A team may consist of a maximum of 3 participants. Design and construct a wired or remote controlled bot capable of fighting in a one on one tournament.
General Rules:

The competition will be played on a knock-out basis consisting of 2 players at a time. The maximum duration of each round will be 5 minutes. Any team that is not ready at the time specified will be disqualified from the competition. The machine will be checked for safety before the competition. Any robot found unsafe to other participants and spectators will be disqualified. The organizers reserve the rights to change any or all of the above rules as they deem fit. Change in rules, if any, will be highlighted on the website and notified to the registered teams. Violation of any rule will lead to disqualification. Judges’ decision shall be treated as final and binding on all.
Note: The bot should conform to the specified conditions.
Safety Rules:

Compliance with all event rules is mandatory. It is expected that competitors stay within the rules and procedures of their own accord and do not require constant policing. If you have a robot or weapon design that does not fit within the categories set forth in these rules or is in some way ambiguous or borderline, please contact the event organizers. All weapons must have a safety cover on any sharp edges
Dimensions and Fabrications:

The bot should fit in a 40 cm x 40 cm x 40 cm box with all mechanisms fully executing motions. Length and width is measured to the extremities of the Robot, i.e. includes any overhanging bodywork, weaponry or protrusions. The external device used to control the bot is not included in the size constraint. Maximum weight of the bot should not exceed 10 kgs. (including battery)
Mobility:

All bots must have easily visible and controlled mobility in order to compete. Movement of robot must be rolling of wheels only. Jumping and hopping is not allowed. Flying (using air foil, helium balloons, ornithopters, etc.) is not allowed.

The team encountering an obstacle, could choose to try and solve the question, else they could continue to proceed towards the center via an alternate route. First team who navigates to the center of the maze will win exciting cash prizes. 

Rules:
▪Maximum 4 players per team. 
▪No electronic gadgets are allowed. 

Date : 22 September, 2018

Venue : EEE Department
electronic-maze.tagline: Remember the "TRIWIZARD MAZE" from harry potter? Ever wanted to experience something similar? Then here is a chance to use your intellect and experience the maze effect!   Come and solve the"Maze" surrounded by few basic technical stuffs, and win exciting cash prices💰💰!!!
electronic-maze.prize: First prize - Rs. 3,000/-, Second Prize -Rs. 2,000/-, Thirsld Prize - Rs. 1,500/-
rules: 1.Maximum 4 players per team.
2. No electronic gadgets are allowed.
3. Should submit their answers within prescribed time.
To solve the maze correctly.

3d-printing.description:
Want to make something that you just conceived?  
Do you have some idea but can't fabricate it?
"According to IEEE, 35% of Engineering Jobs today require 3D Printing Skills"

Here's the best platform for you to accomplish your desires. Presenting to you 3D'ing- A leading company in 3D printing assisting huge companies 

Having conducted workshops all across India, 3D'ing in association with Invente 3.0 brings 3D Printing workshop here in SSN College of Engineering.

ABOUT THE ORGANISERS (3Ding) :

3D’ing is the largest manufacturer of 3D Printers in India. Established in 2013, 3Ding manufactures & deals with a wide variety of 3D Printers ranging from Domestic to Industrial to large format 3D Printers. 3Ding is also an Advisory Partner for Additive Manufacturing for quite a few Large Corporates like Deloitte, PWC, Samsung etc.

3Ding’s parent company, REDD (formerly known as Redd Robotics) is a 5 year old organization with industrial expertise across multiple hardware domains like Robotics, Automation, Embedded Systems, IoT, Mixed Reality, Computer vision, Consumer Electronics, Green Tech, Bio-Medical & Drones.

Now, the only thing left to do is imagine. Be there at SSN on 21 Sep 2018 at the Main Auditorium. Registrations are held at on spot as well.
3d-printing.notes: NO PREREQUISITES REQUIRED. OPEN TO ALL BRANCHES

paper-presentation.description: Paper Presentation is one of the most iconic events in INVENTE 3.0. It is here that students have a great platform to showcase their innovative ideas that could lead to great revolutions in technology.
rules: Teams will have to describe their ideas in a small abstract not more than 250 words. Based on the abstracts sent, teams will get shortlisted to the next round.

Teams shortlisted in the previous round will have to send in the full paper clearly explaining the project idea. Based on the papers sent, teams will get shortlisted to present the paper on the day of the event.

in-a-way-tee.venue:
Prelims:
2A, First Floor, Annexure Block, Dept. of ECE
Finals:
Microprocessor & Microcontroller Lab, Dept. of ECE
in-a-way-tee.description:
“If I had 60 minutes to solve a problem, I’d spend 55 minutes defining it and 5 
                                                                  minutes solving it” - Albert Einstein.

Passionate about technology? Tired of all the theory you’re reading? Want to
challenge your gray matter with a real-life problem? You have come to the right
place! At IN-A-WAY-TE, you will be solving a problem that people face in their
everyday lives. It is an opportunity to learn what can be done and how it can be
done. At the end, you’d have a solution to the problem - your solution - which
you can implement and claim to be a real-time problem solver. What more? You’ll
also learn important aspects of problem solving like first principles thinking,
breaking the problem into modules, and much more. Come and see for yourself!!

RULES:
•	Teams of two or three. 
•	Come and have fun! 😁🏆
rules: PRELIMS : WRITTEN ROUND
20 questions distributed across three sections - puzzles, electronics, programming.
Duration – 30-40 minutes.
FINALE:
Teams may choose between hardware/software for this round. Depending on their choice, different problem statements will be given.
What’s most important is the approach to the problem and not solving it per se.
Duration – 90-120 minutes
•	PROBLEM ANALYSIS

Contestants will be given a real-life problem statement. They have around 30 mins. to think of a solution/algorithm that would solve the problem. At the end of 30 mins, they will be asked to present their idea in front of the jury. This will happen in parallel for all the teams. This is to ensure that they are on the right track and to suggest changes if necessary. Once the teams are clear on what they are planning to do, they can move on to the implementation part.
•	IMPLEMENTATION
The wait is over! Grab the components, take the tools and start makin’ it! Extra points for modularity, number of components used.

solder-it.description:
“Wish to bond Electronics with electronics !!”
There are some who Short-circuit their electronics and run away when the tiniest of shocks hit them and there are those who break and understand what really happened. Those who are passionate about electronics, whose dreams are filled with resistors and capacitors forming a network as beautiful as that of a spider. If you belong to this rare breed of dreamers, then you are in for a treat. Come and join us at “SOLDER IT” @ INVENTE and compete with others who are equally passionate in soldering as you are and surprise us all with all the skills that you possess.
rules: A paper pen test with questions distributed across sections - puzzles, electronics, programming.
Duration – 30 minutes.

Teams will be shortlisted based on the paper pen test and will be given the necessary items such as soldering rod, lead, flux,  transistors etc. You will given a circuit description that you have to solve and solder the components according to the circuit layout you inferred.
You will be scored on how well and neat your circuit is soldered and implemented with points for improvisation as well!!

make-a-thon.description:
Hear Hear Hear!!Yes you! Are you the one among many who always wanted to make a
block of code come to life? Well the magic word is MATLAB ,C++, Python etc .How about we tell you that you will get actually rewarded for the coding? Sounds exciting right? Do you
wanna show us who is the BOSS here? Just jump a few hurdles and the Holy Grail(pun not
intended) is yours .Lets visualize the world together in a new way, with chef de-ouvre software of modeling –MAKE-a-THON (CODING BOSS)not like ( BIGG BOSS) .Can’t wait to meet you all #invente3.0 #BeaCodeking!!
rules: 1)The first round is pen and paper round which will consist questions of MCQ type from basic
programming and MATLAB, C ,C++,python coding, with elimination every 10 minutes based on
number of questions answered correctly.
Team will be given 45 mins​ to solve the questions
2)Top performing teams will be shortlisted to the next rounds based on the points they
score in this round.
3)In case of tie between teams, starred questions will be used to eliminate teams.
Matlab coding ,python,c++ tasks like using GUI, Simulink etc using MATLAB , PYcharm software
based on common usages in programming.(1Hr)

hexathlon.description:
This event is to challenge your knowledge in circuits and coding skills in six different areas.
Some of you will be interested in coding or analysing/building the circuits. So it’s a perfect place
for you to shine in these domains and turn your ideas into actions.
hexathlon.tagline: An Electronic contest in six different domains.
rules: - It will be a written test comprising of 20 questions. Rough sheets will be provided for
working out the problems.
- There will be questions from the following domains:
 Arduino
 MATLAB
 Circuit theory
 Electronic circuits
 Control systems
- 25 minutes will be given to solve all 20 questions.cStar questions will be considered for the
qualifiers.
- There will be 10 teams that qualify to the final round based on how much they score.
- The time taken to complete the paper will be used as a tie breaker.
-The total of 6 tasks will be provided
-The teams have 1 hour 30 mins to try and solve maximum number of tasks within the time
limit.
- Successful completion of each task will get the team 10 points. Partial points maybe
awarded according to the extent of completion
- The tasks will be derived from these 6 domains:
 Coding(C/C++)
 MATLAB
 Arduino
 Circuit theory
 Electronic circuits
 Control systems
- After 30 mins from the start if any teams wish to exchange a task for another task from
another domain. The new task will be of a higher difficulty but it will be from the domain of
their choice. The set of questions for the new tasks are referred to as the star questions.
- If any team completes all tasks before the time limit, they may attend any star question of
their choice.
- The teams may refer to the documentation or help function that we provide to them.

drunk-in-quiz.description:
Round 1 :
Description :
 You will be given 20 general  questions . The questions will be in the form of mind teasers, puzzles etc.  You will have to complete the questions within the given time. Teams for final round will be selected based on the score and time taken.
Round 2 :
Description :
6 drinks ( different taste ) numbered from 1 to 6 will be placed in front of one of the team members. 6 questions numbered 1 to 6 will be asked to the other members of the team continuously. If they know the answer to the particular question they have to urge their teammate to take the corresponding drink spontaneously. After completion of all 6 questions the team should  answer the questions  they opted for.
drunk-in-quiz.tagline: Take a shot, not for the faint-hearted
rules: -     20 questions will be provided with a  total time limit – 15min
-     10 teams will qualify to the final round, based on the marks scored in round 1
-       In case of tie, time taken to complete the paper will be considered.
-	Total Time limit = 1 hour.
-	6 questions will be asked  .
-	You must answer question after completing a drink .
-	The top 3 teams ( based on the points ) will be given awards.

tech-hunt.description:
This is basically a treasure hunt game with slight technical changes as per our ece dept. 
We will give clues that lead to certain clues till u find the last clue.
At the end , components will be given to the teams and certain circuits will be asked to be designed by them.
rules: Basic mcq questions related to circuits and some aptitude questions

The teams that qualify the first round will be given a clue which leads to a sequence of clues . Once they solve a single  clue they will get a piece of the puzzle (circuit) which is basically a component of the circuit and this moves on until they find all the pieces.
The first few teams which find the clues move to the next round
From the given components,the teams need to build a set of circuits that we give to them in minimum possible time

junkyard-jumble.description:
What would you do if you had a good imagination on one hand and junk on the other? Put your hands together and you’ll have what, according to Edison, is sufficient to INVENT! Junkyard Jumble is an event that will put your engineering skills to test by building something out of “supposedly” nothing! 
Remember, “It’s not about ideas, it’s about making ideas HAPPEN”. May the best innovation win!
rules: The first round is a written test that is comprised of aptitude, fundamental engineering (Electronics, Coding etc) and also some riddles to test the participants’ problem solving ability. Do not take round 1 lightly, for the points you score in this round can come to your rescue in round 2 as well.
SPIN THE WHEEL: The contestants will be required to spin a wheel that contains the following options:
Advanced electronics
Digital electronics
Communication systems
Mechanical contraptions

The contestants will be handed a “mystery box” that contains assorted components from each of these domains (which they’ll be choosing by spinning the wheel), and they’ll be given three hours to come build something from a seemingly random collection of things.
Not too familiar with electronics? Worry not! Pick contraptions with the extra points you bagged in round 1!
RULES:
Teams must comprise of 2-3 members.
Additional components will be provided if necessary, depending on the points secured in round 1.
Teams are allowed to use the internet for ideas in the second round, all we’re looking for is a working model and possible inventions!

triwizard-tournament.description:
TRIWIZARD TOURNAMENT:
  	"....It is my very great pleasure to inform you that the Triwizard Tournament will be taking place at SSN (Nope! not Hogwarts) this year" - Albus Dumbledore?
A team comprising of 2-3 members can be formed.
Round-1:
This round consists of puzzles to test your creativity and your problem solving ability, a total of 20 questions. All the teams that clear the minimum requirement will move on to the next round.
Round-2:
 JAM is an all round event that is all about the control of the mind over the mouth. One of the team members is supposed to talk based on a technical situation put forth. The team will be selected for the next round based  on the performance of the participant representing the team.
Round-3:
The final round is totally based on how you persuade others in selling the technical idea/model (choice of your own) and convince the team on investing on your idea. The team should come up with creative ways to sell their idea.
rules: Round-1:
This round consists of puzzles to test your creativity and your problem solving ability, a total of 20 questions. All the teams that clear the minimum requirement will move on to the next round.

JAM is an all round event that is all about the control of the mind over the mouth. One of the team members is supposed to talk based on a technical situation put forth. The team will be selected for the next round based  on the performance of the participant representing the team.

The final round is totally based on how you persuade others in selling the technical idea/model (choice of your own) and convince the team on investing on your idea. The team should come up with creative ways to sell their idea.

connecticart.description:
BID IT TO WIN IT!!!

This event is aimed at testing the participant’s knowledge in the basics of electronics and their ability to apply their theoretical knowledge to design a practical circuit through a series of fun challenges while auctioning for the components!!
So are you ready to display your circuit designing skills????
connecticart.tagline: overcome RESISTANCE.....bid to ur full POTENTIAL!!!!
rules: •	Each team should consist of 2 to 4 members
•	Questions will be of multiple choice type
•	The questions will test the participant’s analytical skills like puzzles, riddles and knowledge in the field of electronics
•	The marking scheme is as follows:
+4-for every correct answer.
-1-for every incorrect answer
0- for unattempted question
•	Only the teams which are shortlisted from round 1 are eligible to participate in this round
•	Based on their points obtained in round 1, each team is given a certain amount of virtual money
•	Components required for building the circuit will be put up for auction and some components will be put up on sale
•	Each team is required to utilize the money wisely and build a circuit or a working model
•	The circuits should be sold back to the organizers
•	The team which makes more money wins the game!

deep-learning-and-computer-vision.description: Human body is one of the most complex machine on Earth. We are fascinated by how the Human Visual System works. How as a human, we see the world, store the visual information and learn from what we see and recognize patterns from previous experiences. The goal of the workshop is to help build an understanding of how to solve real world problems using Computer Vision with examples. We start from motivations for Computer Vision, developing intuitions to solve problems, converting the intuitions into the language of mathematics and finally developing code that represents the mathematics. With the help of Deep learning, we are able to attain state-of-art performance in many Computer Vision Problems. The workshop is meant for those who wants to get a hands-on experience of using DL for solving Computer Vision problems.
deep-learning-and-computer-vision.tagline: Get Ready to design you own Autobot!!

ai-4-good-hackathon.description:
IBM OpenPower and Tech Club SSN present to you, #AI4Good hackathon as a part of SSN Invente 2018!
This is an open themed hackathon that urges participants to create innovative AI solutions that can impact society for the greater good.The challenge will be for people who already have experience working or studying about Deep Learning, they’ll have to solve the challenge taking advantage of the computational power of the IBM Power Systems Platform.

The challenge: Using Deep Learning and the IBM Power platform, participants must develop a solution that enhances society in one of the following domains: 
1. Healthcare
2. Governance
3. Safety

Recommended background for the challenge:
1. Experience programming with python
2. Basic knowledge of machine learning and deep learning
3. Basic knowledge of the framework Tensorflow

A workshop will be held before the hackathon. 

Duration: 24 Hours
Participants per team: 3 (Max)

Agenda:
Friday, 21st 
● 1.00 pm to 5.00 pm: Welcoming the Participants and PowerAI workshop
● 5.00 pm:  Hackathon Commencement
      
Saturday, 22nd
● 4:00 pm: Demonstration of the prototypes!
● 5:30 pm: Awards

biogonize.description:
Totally 3 rounds.
1.Takku takku takkunu- a fast video clip of pictures related to engineering and u have to identify them.
2 Innovation out of waste- making models out of miscellaneous items.
3.Oru kadha solta sir-Should create a story with the given biological words.
And a team of 2 should participate
biogonize.tagline: It's not just your brains that need to play!
rules: Fast video will be played and u have to identify the things in that video.The one who find maximum things wins the game
U will be given few points using that points u should buy waste material and to make model out of that waste
Should form a story using the given biomedical words

scintelligence-3.0.description:
Leggo again!!!!!Expose The scrumdelicious… The hard earned thirst!!
Because engineering is complicated enough, we make it much more complicated. Come as good as it gets! To the resurging SCINTELLIGENCE 3.0 bundled up with newer better and bigger rounds.

Prelims:

1) Tap to cap.

Finals
1) Cap yourself Sherlock.
2) Wolf of the wall street.
scintelligence-3.0.tagline: Tighten!! the power is on your side and Don’t leave the house without prize.
rules: Bounce OFF!
Forget pinballs, for we now have bin and balls!
Time duration: 30mins
Scoring: 2pts / answer.
Tap to cup
Toss the spoon really soon, get the clue to edge over the crew.
Time duration: 30mins

Where do I kept my bit?

Go for it and tap into the pit!

Are you the wolf? Show us how loud you can howl!

tellurians.description: Explore, learn and have fun by flying to various planets and decipher the various zestful and intriguing quizzes and puzzles to complete your mission.
rules: A TEAM CAN CONSIST OF 2-4 MEMBERS!!
Round I: Planet Gliese
Quiz-o-mania: The participants should answer a set of technical and non-technical questions within the stipulated time.
The teams who are qualified will be informed and requested to be present for the next rounds which will be held on Day 2.
Round II: Planet Fye
94%: The goal of “94%” is to find the top 94% of the given answers to a specific question. There are many possible answers to each question, but the trick is to find the most popular answers.
Logo Quiz: A description of a company or a product will be given; the participants should find the logo.
Connexions: A total of four pictures will be given and each picture will be linked to each other, the participants should guess the answer.
4 teams will be selected based on the points they received and qualified for the final round.
Round III: Planet Kepler
Who am I? : Clues will be given and the participants have to find the answer.

Treasure Hunt: Based on the clues from “Who am I?”, the participants will further be given more clues to reach various spots and find a key to unlock the box in the last spot which contains the puzzle which needs to be solved.

paper-presentation.description: Express your enthusiasm for the biomedical field by presenting your innovations and ideas.
rules: Abstracts should be sent by 10th September

matalino.venue: Biomedical department, 1st Floor, LS 04 ( final year class room)
matalino.description:
4 rounds, 2 members per team
1.high on volume ( find the word amidst the high volume) 
2.fire the five (Q&A) 
3.music trivia ( musical chair kindof thing) 
4.mathoscience ( equation solving and Bio related Q&A)
rules: Round1:High on volume!
Earphones are provided to one member. List of words are given to another. The one with earphones have to find the words amidst the high music..Time limit:2min.
Round2:Fire the five!!
Five questions are given. They have to find that five answers. The first letter of the five answers gives the main answer. Time limit:5min
Round3:Music Trivia
Similar to musical chair.. Questions are displayed in projector.Answers are pasted on chairs.The team member have to find out answer and sit on the correct chair.
Round4:Mathoscience

An equation is given. They have to solve the equation and find the number. They have to run to that numbered bench..One technical question will be given there.They have to find answer and again convert it into number.

demaxxon.description: Demaxxon is full of interesting challenges and innovative mind always look up for the challenges,which aids in understanding the secrets of technology.
demaxxon.tagline: Try and Fail but don't Fail to Try
rules: Choose one among the collection of domains and answer for that questions duration 1 hour.
Face the technical as well as non technical questions and challenge with the opposite team duration 2 hours.
Find maximum number of things in a technical/non technical video duration 1hour.

hospital-hustle.description: A virtual money game where the ultimate goal is to build and keep the hospital alive even when the spurious accidents do the rounds.  Design your very own hospital, tweak every detail and show us that you own all the tricks of the business. Become an aspiring manager, a successful planner and an ace practioner all at the same time.
hospital-hustle.tagline: Play or bid to keep your stakes high to build your own hospital
hospital-hustle.prize: Winner - Rs 3500 First Runner up - Rs 2000 Second Runner up - RS 1500
rules: 1. A hustle team of minimum 3 and maximum 5 members will be allocated a base deposit of 50000 virtual bucks and a manual listing the details of machines/equipments available in the hospital will be given.
2. Teams will have to auction to buy certain equipments and raw materials to start designing a particular department of the hospital.

1. The price of the raw materials will inflate and deflate. Some spurious accidents will be posted on the teams and the teams will have to overcome them by earning more and more bucks either by selling their products and shares or by playing dare games.
2. By the end of the second round, only the top five teams with higher number of bucks will be selected for the final showdown.

Fnal showdown is fun and frolic. Your stakes might taste profit or might meet accident. It all depends on how well you manage shares and how artistic is your design in terms of planning. The team that manages to function the hospital and is able to maintain good figure shares with the administration wins!

sapiens-washout.description: You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them, so shoe yourself and spruce up to show your skills and win exciting prizes
rules: Rules
1.Finish within the clock to prove your skills .
2.Solo or Team based depending upon the task.

misterioso.tagline: Unlocking mysteries at the speed of thought!
rules: Teams of 2 or 3 will be formed on random basis.
Each team will qualify for the subsequent round by enacting the answers to a set of questions in the format of charades
Sometimes the simplest of concepts can be tricky and nerve wracking to answer.
The second round will be a lightning quiz round where teams will be judged on the basis of their speed to answer questions in a short span of time.
Theme Round:
Props and items for the selected theme will be displayed.
Shortlisted teams will be asked a set of questions pertaining to the theme.
A correct answer will enable them to secure the props and items.
The team with the maximum props and items will be declared as the Winner.

pubg-mobile-tournament.tagline: Do you have what it takes to be the last man standing? Come battle it out with us at SSNCE!
pubg-mobile-tournament.notes: Pre-Register for the tournament through the above link.
rules: Top 5 teams will be selected from 4 games
A bonus round will be held(Arcade matches) to select wild card entries
The final Classic TPP squad game will decide the winner

augmented-reality-and-virtual-reality.description:
• Ever dreamt of becoming a game engineer?! Have an ardent fervor for deploying your own gaming  scenes? Here is an ultimate chance to develop and deploy Virtual Reality games/any varied platform.This workshop basically works on areas of designing and development of an application related to augmented reality and virtual reality.
• The workshop is handled by professionals from the Digital Meridian.
• The session starts at eight thirty and ends by three in the evening.
• There are refreshments and by twelve we will break for lunch, soon the session resumes within forty five minutes.
• The first one hour of the workshop is an introduction to AR, VR & MR.
• For the next one hour the various fundamentals of VR are explained.
• After which the immersive app called "phobia" in VR app development using the unity Google unityand VR,c# begins.
• You can also learn on how to use a VR camera inside UNITY, implementing head rotation, sensors used in VR, lighting, creating a GUI for VR applications and what are all the game objects, materials, transformations and animations using scripting and c#.
• Then the track turns to interactive student profile generation in AR using SDK's software platform and devices. Then AR APP development is done using VUFORIA & UNITY.
• The workshop ends with advanced level of app development using c# scripting.
• The other technologies being used are HTC vive, Microsoft hololens.
augmented-reality-and-virtual-reality.tagline: Simulate and experience an immersive virtual environment that transcends the physical reality

as-you-like-it.description: As you like it is an event with fun oriented mathematical games. It need not be conceptually intricate to involve deeper computational underpinnings. This event differ sharply from mathematical quiz in that mathematical quiz require specific mathematical expertise to complete, whereas it do not require a deep knowledge of mathematics to play. They are of deep interest in the field of recreational mathematics. These games have simple rules and match procedures with logic and recreation. If you and your team think that you deserve the honour, then this is your opportunity. Come and grab it!
rules: Team consists of maximum of three members. There will be ten event with recreational mathematics. Each event has separate points based on the performance. Final points will be the cumulative score of whole event.

Prelims:EH-5 EEE third floor
           Finals :ECE central seminar hall

Finals : 1.30 pm to 2.30 pm
math-quiz.description: This event will test both your aptitude and general knowledge about the mathematical world. It's a 2 round event comprising of a pen-paper and a quiz style round
rules: PRELIMS
•	20 questions in total
•	Time limit : 30 minutes
•	10 questions from aptitude and 10 from general plus a bonus question. All questions carry multiple choice except the bonus question.
•	Each correct answer earns your team 2 points. Aptitude section carries negative marking.

•	Top 6-8 teams will qualify for the finals.

FINALS
•	The Final round will consist of 6 rounds containing 2 rounds each from general and aptitude section and 2 special rounds.

bigg-boss.description: As the name says "Bigg Boss" is an event that tests your adaptability along with your mathematical knowledge. paper-presentation.description:
AREAS & TOPICS FOR PRESENTATION :
MECHANICAL ENGINEERING :
1.Mathematics in supply chain management.
2.Scheduling problem using operation research.
3.Game theory.
ELECTRONICS AND COMMUNICATION ENGINEERING:
Signal processing :

2.Transforms ( Fourier, Laplace)

Brain network, signals using Graph theory and stochastic process
rules: Candidates should send their paper in soft copy to the e-mail address ssnexlog@gmail.com before the LAST DATE (19/09/2018). PAPERS MAILED AFTER 19/09/2018, 08.00PM WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED. Can be a team of two members. Spot entries are not allowed. Accepted papers will be intimated through their mail id on or before 20/09/2018.

The presentation time is 8 minutes and the queries for 2 minutes for each paper. Selected candidates should bring 2 hard copies at the time of presentation. 2 copies of abstract for the presentation in hardcopy required on the day of presentation, not exceeding 300 words. Judges decision will be final and will not be further entertained.

22nd September
Prelims: 10.00 am to 12.00 pm
Finals :1 .00 pm to 2.30 pm
dumb-c.description: Are you a math wiz who's tired of conventional competitions? Or are you someone who loves express oneself with a myriad of expressions and actions? Do people say that you're great at understanding others with no words being spoken? Or are you simply someone who's looking for some fun? Well look no more! Here's an event that's sure to entertain all of you! Come, participate in the Dumb-C event at Exlog 2018, the national level technical symposium organised by the department of Mathematics at SSN College of Engineering. This isn't just your everyday charades game. It's got different rounds of exciting variations of Dumb-C, each with a Mathematical twist. You don't want to miss this one. Participate to enjoy the fun.
rules: Maximum of 3 per team and minimum of 2. An aptitude test to test your talent.
A mathematical term enacted by a team mate and guessed by the others on the team. Team that takes the least time wins.

Connect the pictures or Guess the word. 4 pictures will be given and contestants have to understand the similarity shared among them and guess the word. Else one of the contestants will be given a word and 4 relevant terms should be said to guess the word.

creodel.description: Aren’t you tired with the technical equations last for several pages? Wanna convert your observations into a visual model? ‘CREODEL’ gives you the opportunity to simplify your observed phenomenon and to arrive at a computationally tractable model.
rules: Problems based on area and volume calculations (time bound and no use of electronic gadgets)
Geometric and trigonometric application based problems
Equations are to be solved and accordingly models have to be made
